body_html:
I tried both, as mentioned above. Initially via conda using:

conda install pytorch torchvision cuda90 -c pytorch

and then I removed the package and tried reinstalling via:

pip install http://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu90/torch-0.3.1-cp36-cp36m-linux_x86_64.whl
pip install torchvision

However neither fixed the problem. I see that the PyTorch site now lists a CUDA 9.1 version that wasn't available at the time of this issue. I'm going to try that as soon as I can and maybe that will resolve it.

body:
I tried both, as mentioned above. Initially via conda using: 

conda install pytorch torchvision cuda90 -c pytorch 

and then I removed the package and tried reinstalling via:

pip install http://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu90/torch-0.3.1-cp36-cp36m-linux_x86_64.whl 
pip install torchvision

However neither fixed the problem. I see that the PyTorch site now lists a CUDA 9.1 version that wasn't available at the time of this issue. I'm going to try that as soon as I can and maybe that will resolve it.
